intro: Rungia saranganensis, commonly known as the Sarangan wild pepper, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when ripe, containing a single seed. Rungia saranganensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
